entry.title: OGF-44 - Project: OGF-44
entry.content:
OGF 44 will be held May 21-22, 2015 co-located with the EGI Conference 2015 that will be held May 18-22, 2015 in Lisbon, Portugal. The OGF group meetings will run from Thursday through Friday and will highlight mutual topics between the networking, security, applications and API design communities. All OGF groups are encouraged to meet at this event.

Details of sessions to be planned at this conference will be posted on the events home page shortly. Meanwhile, please visit the EGI Conference pages for relevant event registration, hotel, local transportation, and venue details.

entry.title: OGF-43 - Project: OGF-43
entry.content: The Open Grid Forum will meet during the week of March 18-21, 2015 co-located with the GENI Engineering Conference 22 (GEC22) and US Ignite Application Summit that will be held March 23-26, 2015 at the Hilton Crystal City Hotel at Washington Reagan National Airport in Crystal City, Virginia near Washington DC, USA. Use the "Issues" tab above to view submitted session requests, or click on the "new issue" link within that page to enter a response to the call for session proposals.

entry.title: OGF-41 - Project: OGF-41
entry.content: The Open Grid Forum will meet during the week of July 13-18, 2014 co-located with the XSEDE 2014 conference in Atlanta, GA, USA. Use the "Issues" tab above to view submitted session requests, or click on the "new issue" link within that page to enter a response to the call for session proposals.

entry.title: Mailing Lists - Project: Mailing Lists
entry.content:
OGF accomplishes its work through open forums, interactions and events that build the community, explore trends, share optimal approaches, document findings and consolidate these results where appropriate into standards. The output products that result from this process document and codify best practices and standards that provide the basis for some of the largest and most powerful operational computing infrastructure systems in the world.

For a list of the OGF Mailing Lists, see the following link:

entry.title: OGF-40 - Project: OGF-40
entry.content: The Open Grid Forum will meet 15-17 January 2014 on the campus of Oxford University, Oxford UK. Use the "Issues" tab above to view submitted session requests, or click on the "new issue" link within that page to enter a response to the call for session proposals.

entry.title: Public Comments Archive - Project: Public Comments Archive
entry.content: This project archives public comments for documents which went through the OGF document pipeline. For commenting on documents currently in the pipeline, see Public Comments.

entry.title: SVN Migration Test - Project: SVN Migration Test
NomCom - Project: NomCom
entry.content: The OGF Nomination Committee coordinates the OGF structure, i.e. coordinates the election of area directors, GFSG and board members, etc.
